question:

-30x_1+180x_2-60x_3  & = & 400 \\
-20x_1-60x_2+150x_3  & = & 300 \\
\end{cases}$$
 
Will the Gauss-Seidel method solve the problem?
answer3: Only if the initial approximation is $(0,0,0)$.

question: The Fire Safety Department conducted a study to determine the percentage of households in the country that have smoke detectors. $1000$ households were checked and $875$ of them had a detector. Identify the sample of interest.
answer2: All the households of the country.
answer3: All the smoke detectors of the country.
answer4: All the households that have a detector.

Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, $f(x,y,z)=x^{2}yz-\cos \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}.$ Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}.$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

question:

x & + & 2y & = & 4 \\
x & - & 2y & = & 0 \\
4x & + & 3y & = & 12
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{24}{11},\,\frac{12}{11}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions of the form $\left(2y,\,y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer1: $x=0$ is a maximizer, and $x=4$ is a minimizer.

question:
Consider the subspaces of $\mathbb{R}^2$, $S_1$  generated by $A=\{(2, 3), (4, 5)\}$ and $S_2=\{(x, y)\in \mathbb{R}^2: x-2y=0\}$. 
The vector space $S_1\cap S_2$ is:
Let $u_1=(0,0,1,1)$, $u_2=(0,1,1,1)$, $u_3=(1,1,1,2)$ and $u_4=(-1,0,1,0)$ vectors of $\mathbb{R}^4$. Choose the wrong answer.

Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} + 7x_{2} + 4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1} + 2x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 10\\ 
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+2x_{3}\leq 10\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]
answer2:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\leq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+u_{2}\\
	   	    \text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]

question: Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

Consider the subsets  $\displaystyle A=\{(1, 1, 1), (0, 1, 1), (1, 2, 3)\}$ and $\displaystyle B=\left\{(1, 1, 1), \left(-\frac{2}{3}, \frac{1}{3}, \frac{1}{3}\right), \left(0, -\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $A$ isn't an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer2: $A$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $B$ isn't an orhtogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer3: $A$ and $B$ are both orthogonal basis of of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $A$ and $B$ are both non-orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$

question:

question: Consider $T:V \longrightarrow W$ a linear transformation and assume $dim(range(T))=3$. Choose the right answer.

answer1: The probability to make a Type $I$ error is $0.05$.
answer2: The probability of making a Type $II$ error is $0.95$.
answer3: The probability that the sample is randomly selected is $0.05$.
answer4: The probability, that the null hypothesis will be rejected is $0.05$.

question: Considering the similarity criteria of triangles, choose the correct statement.
answer1: Two scalene triangles are similar if two internal angles of one of them are congruent to two of the internal angles of the other.
answer2: Two isosceles triangles are similar if the length of two sides of one of them is directly proportional to the length of two sides of the other.
answer3: Two right triangles are always similar.
answer4: Two scalene triangles are never similar.
